column4: What is the state of art in reverse-engineering the Exchange protocol? Why is it that Blacberry, Visto, Smartner, Roadsync and bunch of other 3rd party tools to access Exchange from a phone does exist, but no real exchange client fot Linux? (OWA does not cut it, because out company OWA is behind a non-standard portal, restricted and useless).
there wouldn't seem a need to do so, so-to-speak.
1000 million people work for companies that use Exchange mail. Do you say there is no need for them to access that from Linux?
i'm not debating it in here :)
